articles.author: Fred Vogelstein
articles.title: Inside Facebook's Plan to Safeguard the 2018 Election
articles.description: The social media giant has assembled a team of geeks, spooks, hackers, and lawyers to prevent a repeat of the 2016 abuse and manipulation on its network.
articles.content: Deep in the bowels of Facebook 's serpentine campus in Menlo Park, California is a room about 25-feet-square that may have a lot to do with how the world thinks about the company in the coming months. It looks like a Wall Street trading floor, with screens on… [+5701 chars]

articles.author: Julie Muncy
articles.title: 'Black Ops 4' Review: Making 'Call of Duty' For a 'Fortnite' World
articles.description: A new battle-royale mode that leans into the trope of the moment makes 'Black Ops 4' the franchise's most honest title to date.
articles.content: Blackout, Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 's new game mode, begins the same way all battle-royale sequences do. You fly over a remote warscapethis time, in a series-appropriate attack helicopterand drop in, bristling with fear and aggression. What follows is by now… [+4358 chars]

articles.author: Jeffrey Van Camp
articles.title: Roku Premiere Plus Review (2018): Affordable 4K HDR Streaming
articles.description: Roku brings the price of 4K TV streaming down to new lows, with a few caveats.
articles.content: A few years ago, I gave my parents-in-law a Chromecast for Christmas. They needed an easy way to watch Netflix and Chromecast was the hip, hot new thing. This will be perfect, I thought. I was wrong. The problems added up quickly. Their Wi-Fi was spotty, so t… [+5635 chars]

articles.author: Levi Tillemann
articles.title: The Faster, Cheaper, Better Way to Charge Electric Vehicles
articles.description: Opinion: Forget fast-charging. Battery swapping is back—and it's the tech of the future.
articles.content: Chinese carmaker NIO, the worlds newest electric vehicle unicorn, has a big idea: battery swapping. In theory, the process is quicker and more convenient than a fast charge. A driver rolls into a battery swap station, and a robot replaces the drained battery … [+6043 chars]

articles.author: Christopher Null
articles.title: 3 Wine Aroma Kits Tested: Aromabar, Aromaster, and Le Nez du Vin
articles.description: Is your schnoz a schlub? Strengthen your sniffer by teaching it to discern common wine aromas with one of these training kits.
articles.content: I'll be forthright: Improving your ability to smell various aromas in a glass of wine is not a major concern for most people. Correcting your friends by saying, "That's not blackberry you're smelling, it's blackcurrant " is less likely to engender respect and… [+7106 chars]

articles.author: Adrienne So
articles.title: Review: The Updated Fitbit Charge 3 is More of the Same, but Better
articles.description: It's an advanced fitness tracker, but it's close enough to a smartwatch to make you wonder—why not just one of those?
articles.content: Do you need a fitness wearable? Obviously, yes. Even if you're not interested in counting every step, every day, you can now use a fitness wearable to check your texts, listen to music, or effortlessly pay for a macchiato. The increasingly porous boundary bet… [+7259 chars]

articles.title: My Father Says He’s a ‘Targeted Individual.’ Maybe We All Are
articles.description: My dad is one of thousands who believe the government is subjecting them to mind control. As a daughter and a journalist, I felt a duty to investigate his claims. Have these individuals been America’s prophets all along?
articles.content: I was 11 when my father destroyed the condominium where he was living. Searching for hidden transistors or other devices that might be beaming voices into his skull, he took a hammer to the walls, shoved his fists into the holes, and pulled off chunks of plas… [+37738 chars]

articles.title: The Feds Just Hit Notorious Swatter Tyler Barriss With 46 New Charges. He Intends to Plead Guilty
articles.description: Prosecutors in California have filed 46 new counts against Tyler Barriss for bomb threats, fraud, and swatting incidents nationwide. He’s angling to get the case transferred to Kansas and intends to plead guilty.
